metadata.title: CVE-2021-47121 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:caif: fix memory leak in cfusbl_device_notify In case of caif_enroll_dev()fail, allocated link_support won't be assigned to the correspondingstructure. So simply free allocated pointer in case of error.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-hwe package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-154.161~16.04.1').
linux-kvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1110.117~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1122.135~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1107.121~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1079.87~16.04.1').
